intro: Odontadenia duckei, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Odontadenia duckei is often found in heathlands and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
